summary: ENBs look great, but they come in at a similary great performance hit. This mod aims to bring ENB-like graphics without breaking down on your FPS using the ReShade Injector and MasterEffect Reborn shaders.
descriptionHtml:
[color=#ff0000][size=4][size=5]DO YOU WANT GOOD GRAPHICS??[/size] [/size][color=#ffd966][size=4]-YEES!![/size][/color]
[size=5]DO YOU WANT IT WITH NO BIG PERFORMANCE HIT??[/size][/color] [color=#ffd966][size=4]-um, is this even possible?[/size][/color][size=4]

[color=#38761D][size=5][font=Comic Sans MS]YES[/font][/size][/color][color=#38761D][size=5] IT IS![/size][/color]

[img]http://static-5.nexusmods.com/15/images/110/13639300-1429389655.jpg[/img]

Skyrim Reshaded - ENB-like graphics with no performance hit

[size=3]Yes, you can get really good graphics with a minimum FPS-hit (if you overdo it) using a very powerful tool called [color=#a61c00][size=5]R[/size][/color][color=#ffff00][size=5]e[color=#00ff00]S[color=#00ffff]h[color=#ff7700]a[color=#0000ff]d[color=#9900ff]e [/color][/color][/color][/color][/color][/size][/color]
by Crosire.
With this and the [size=5][color=#980000]M[/color][color=#f6b26b]a[/color][color=#0000ff]s[/color][color=#6aa84f]t[/color][color=#ff00ff]e[/color][color=#00ffff]r[/color][color=#85200C]E[/color][color=#6fa8dc]f[/color][color=#f6b26b]f[/color][color=#999999]e[/color][color=#ffff00]c[/color][color=#ff00ff]t[/color] [color=#6aa84f]R[/color][color=#3c78d8]e[/color][color=#a61c00]b[/color][color=#ff00ff]o[/color][color=#38761D]r[/color][color=#3c78d8]n[/color][/size] shaderpack by Marty McFly, you have nearby endless options to customize your game's appereance, with no measerable performance-hit.
The screenshots are taken with quite a few mods installed, but you can get similar results in less than 10 minutes.
The most important ones are:

[url=http://reshade.me]ReShade[/url] with the [url=http://reshade.me/forum/shaderpack-mastereffect/161-mastereffect-reborn-official-thread]MasterEffect Reborn shaderpack
[/url]
[/size][/size][size=3][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/17802/?]Climates of Tamriel
[/url]or
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/52423/?]Pure Weather[/url]

[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/27043/?]Enhanced Lights and FX
[/url]or
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/27043/?]Realistic Lighting Overhaul
[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/41076/?]Realistic Water Two[/url]
or
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/1111/?]Pure Waters[/url]

and your favourite texture pack, mine is [/size][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/46925/?][size=3]Tamriel Reloaded-Textures and Parallax[/size].
[/url]

[size=3][url=http://reshade.me]ReShade[/url] is a post-processing injector. If you get a good shaderpack like [/size][size=3][url=http://reshade.me/forum/shaderpack-mastereffect/161-mastereffect-reborn-official-thread]MasterEffect Reborn[/url], you can change a game's look and feel in just minutes with so many different effects to choose from, for example simple colour-changing effects, lighting-related shaders like Bloom or Godrays, image-enhancing effects like sharpen or SMAA and depth-effects like ambient occlusion and even Depth of Field!



As Reshade is still a Beta and it gets updated really quickly, I suggest checking [i][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/46925/?]here[/url][/i] every few week or so if you decide to use this mod. [/size][size=3][size=3]Also, don't forget to update [url=http://reshade.me/forum/shaderpack-mastereffect/161-mastereffect-reborn-official-thread]MasterEffect Reborn.[/url][/size]
Just go ahead and copy your old Mastereffect.h if you cannot remember your settings, install the new version by renaming ReShade32 to d3d9.dll and copy/paste it in your Skyrim folder overwriting the old one. To update MasterEffect Reborn, copy/paste the MasterEffect Folder, ReShade.fx and Mastereffect.h files into your Skyrim folder, open Mastereffect.h and set the values to your liking.
[/size]




[size=4][u][size=5]Installation: [/size]

mainly just like ENB:
[/u]1. Disable AA in the Launcher, set AF to your liking.
2. Go to steamapps\common\Skyrim[/size]
[size=4]3. Take the 3 files ( d3d9.dll; Mastereffect.h; ReShade.fx )[/size] [size=4]and copy/paste them into this folder.
4. Take the MasterEffect folder and drag/drop it into the same folder.[/size]
[size=4]5. Go to My Documents\My Games\Skyrim and open SkyrimPrefs.ini
6. Set this value:
[center][Display]
bDefferredShadows=0[/center][/size][size=4][size=4]7. Run the game.[/size]
8. Done![/size]

[size=4][size=3]NMM-installation is not possible.

[/size][/size]
[size=3]If you want your shadows and water reflection to look a bit more ENB-like, there are several steps to do:

1. Install ELFX or RLO. I prefer ELFX because it makes things even darker, but that's your chioce.
2. Go to My Documents\My Games\Skyrim and open SkyrimPrefs.ini
3. Set these values:

[/size][center][size=3][Display]
iBlurDeferredShadowMask=5
iShadowMapResolutionSecondary=4096
iShadowMapResolutionPrimary=4096
[/size][size=3]iShadowMapResolutioin=4096

[Water]
iWaterReflectHight=1024
iWaterReflectWidth=1024
[/size][/center][size=3]
[/size][size=3]4. Open Sykrim.[/size][size=3]ini in the same folder and set these values:[/size]
[center]
[size=3][Display]
iShadowMapResolutionPrimary=4096
fSunShadowUpdateTime= 0.000
fSunUpdateThreshold=0.100[/size][/center][size=3]You CAN set the shadow values higher, e.g. 6144 or 8192, but it can be quite a performance hit.[/size][size=3]
I would not recommend cranking up the water reflections even higher as the effect doesn't scale with the performance hit.
The last two ones are optional, they make your shadows a bit more 'dynamic'; they change position much more frequently.
[/size]

[center][size=3]If you want a Deaph of Field-effect, use [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/12525/?]DYNAVISION[/url].[/size][/center]



[size=5][u]Compatibility: [/u][/size]

[color=#ff0000][size=4]NOT[color=#ffffff] compatable with ENBseries or SweetFX.
Every other mod should work just fine.


[/color][/size][/color]
[color=#ff0000][size=4][color=#ffffff][size=4]Don't forget to check out my other mod, [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/64889/?]Skyrim ScaryShaded[/url] dark and scary shaders.


[/size]
[/color][/size][/color][u][size=5]Credits:[/size][/u]

[size=3]First things first: A HUGE [color=#f1c232]Thank you!![color=#ffffff] to [url=http://reshade.me]Crosire[/url],
and, of course, also a big shoutout to [/color][/color][/size][url=http://reshade.me/forum/shaderpack-mastereffect/161-mastereffect-reborn-official-thread][size=3]Marty McFly[/size][/url] [size=3]for the shaderpack.[/size]
[color=#6aa84f][size=4]You made this mod possible.[/size][/color]
author: master6TheOriginal

files.name: Skyrim ReShaded V0.2
files.changelogHtml:
Lensflare has been reduced in intencity by 20% as it was much to strong
lensflare has been changed in color by just a tiny little bit, nearly unnoticable but still nice to have

Standart version: a little less oversaturated
less vibrant version: a little less red and overall less intensive
-new, much more efficient AO
-new ReShade version 0.18.7
-new MasterEffect Reborn version 1.1.287

files.changelogHtml:
Quite a few:

-more advanced colormapping
-much more realistic lensflare
